data.text:
Christiane Amanpour is a top journalist who has been in journalism for over three decades and still counting. She is notable for her work with CNN in various capacities, including as an international reporter and program anchor. She also interviewed several prominent personalities, politicians and statesmen.

As a journalist, Christiane has been seen covering news around the world, particularly in the Middle East, and has participated in in-depth discussions of political issues in the United States. Find out everything you read about the biography, net worth and family life of this Amazon media.

Who is Christiane Amanpour?

Christiane is a British-Iranian television presenter, journalist and media personality who currently works as an international correspondent for CNN. She was born under the full name of Christiane Maria Heideh Amanpour on January 12, 1958 in London, United Kingdom, but grew up in Tehran, Iran with her sister Lizzy Amanpour. They were raised by their parents Mohammad Amanpour and Patricia Amanpour.

Her father is said to be from a wealthy and influential Persian family in Tehran and happens to be a devout Muslim while her mother was a Briton born in Paris, France and also a devout Christian.

Records show that Christiane had her early education in Iran and when she was eleven years old she moved to London to continue her education at a girls school called Holy Cross Convent. She then studied at the New Hall School, owned by the Catholics of Essex, then at the University of Rhode (USA) where she obtained a degree in journalism.

Career – CNN & PBS

Upon leaving college, Christiane Amanpour was employed by the Cable News Network (CNN) in Atlanta, Georgia as an office assistant. She quickly became a journalist, and her first major assignment as a journalist was covering the Iran-Iraq War. Subsequently, she was transferred to the CNN bureau in New York as an international reporter. She also worked on other missions such as the Bosnian War, the Persian Gulf War and many other conflicts in which she was called “courageous” as she carried out her task with courage.

Christiane Amanpour was granted Chief International Reporter status in CNN and her show titled Amanpour was launched. The show is an everyday interview show that ran from 2009 to 2010 when she announced she would be leaving CNN to join American Broadcasting Cooperation (ABC) in 2010.

She became the host of the ABC program This Week where she was opportune to interview Muammar Gaddafi and his sons in February 2011. However, she would leave the television station later the same year to return to CNN and she resumed her eponymous show, Amanpour in 2012.

Besides working with CNN and ABS, Christiane also started working with the public television station (PBS). She was named in 2018 to succeed Charlie Ross. In September of the same year, she became the host of the program. Amanpour & Company this is still airing on the station.

husband, son

The veteran journalist has not only maintained a successful career so far, she also has a romantic and successful married life. Christiane Amanpour is married to journalist James Rubin, former assistant secretary of state for public affairs in the Clinton administration and also a former ambassador.

The couple are said to have known each other for quite a long time but officially got engaged in 1998 and towards the end of the same year, Christiane Amanpour and James Rubin got married. The couple have only one child, a son named Darius John Robin, born in 2000.

After enjoying 20 years of marital bliss, it has been officially released that Christiane and James are set to divorce. The divorce certificates were filed in July 2018 and the procedure for their separation is ongoing.

Net value

Details about her net worth show that the CNN International Correspondent has amassed a very good sum for herself as a journalist and TV host with an estimated net worth of around $12.5 million, but the exact amount of her salary has not yet been revealed.
